result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael A Wheaton

records.addlTxt: Order on Competency signed by Judge Michael O. Bohren on 10/21/22

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt:
10:27 AM Defendant Michael A Wheaton appeared by video.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Michael A Wheaton.  Prosecuting attorney Chelsea Thompson in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case called to review the competency report filed 10/19/22.
Both counsel have received and reviewed the doctor's report.
Defense agrees with the doctor's findings.
State is not objecting to the doctor's findings.
Court adopts the findings in the report.
Court finds the defendant not competent and not likely to regain competency within the time limits.
State requests the case be suspended and the defendant released from his conditions of bond.
Court orders the case be suspended and the defendant released from his conditions of bond.
Review hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to have no contact with victims A & B listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

8:17 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Niki Kane. Defendant Michael A Wheaton in court.  Attorney Maura Ann Mcmahon in court for Michael A Wheaton. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. 
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Court advises of right to an attorney. Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Attorney McMahon is appointed. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. 
DEFENSE COUNSEL REQUESTS ORDER FOR COMPETENCY PURSUANT TO SEC.. 971.14(2).  Court grants request and orders the defendant be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.  To be done as an outpatient basis within 30 days.
Review hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
